original_title: FLOSS Weekly Episode 781: Resistant To The Wrath Of God
original_content:
This week Jonathan Bennett and Doc Searls sit down with Mathias Buus Madsen and Paolo Ardoino of Holepunch, to talk about the Pear Runtime and the Keet serverless peer-to-peer platform. What happens when you take the technology built for BitTorrent, and apply it to a messaging app? What else does that allow you to do? And whats the secret to keeping the service running even after the servers go down?


Holepunch (the company behind Pear Runtime): https://www.holepunch.to
Pear Runtime Website  https://pears.com/
Launch Press Release  https://pears.com/news/holepunch-unveils-groundbreaking-open-source-peer-to-peer-app-development-platform-pear-runtime/
Twitter  https://twitter.com/Pears_p2p
Documentation  https://docs.pears.com
Keet  http://www.keet.io
Did you know you can watch the live recording of the show right in the Hackaday Discord? Have someone youd like use to interview? Let us know, or contact the guest and have them contact us!

Direct Download in DRM-free MP3.
If youd rather read along, heres the transcript for this weeks episode.

title: Holepunch社について：PearランタイムとKeetサーバーレスプラットフォーム
body: Holepunch社のMathias Buus MadsenとPaolo Ardoinoと、BitTorrent技術を使ったPear RuntimeやKeetサーバーレスプラットフォームについて話し合う。メッセージングアプリに応用すると何ができるか、そしてサーバダウン後もサービスを維持する秘訣とは。
titles: Holepunch社について：PearランタイムとKeetサーバーレスプラットフォーム
BitTorrent技術を応用したメッセージングアプリ
サーバーが落ちてもサービスを維持する秘訣
Pearランタイム：オープンソースのピア・ツー・ピアアプリ開発プラットフォーム
FLOSS Weekly Podcast：電子工作愛好者必見
